wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Napier Kennedy (1852, London – 1898, St Ives) was a British artist. He studied at the Slade School and was renowned for his mythological paintings.
He was elected to the Royal Institute of Oil Painters in 1883 and became an Associate of the Royal Hibernian Academy in 1896.His wife Lucy (née Marwood) was also an artist. Kennedy died in St Ives, Cornwall, in 1898, at the age of 46.
